column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: Providing diversification opportunities for Australian investors by expanding the ASX product offering. In recent years, ASX has facilitated the launch of new innovative investment product types, including active exchange-traded Funds (ETFs) and hybrid and dual-access fund structures. Over the past five years, the market capitalisation of ASX-listed Exchange-Trade Products (ETPs) has grown at a compounded annual growth rate of 30.1%
column20: Diversification opportunities, Product offering expansion, Innovative investment products

column13: a targeted offshore business development strategy complements our solid domestic focus. The offshore strategy prioritises New Zealand and the United States while remaining open to selective opportunities in other jurisdictions
column20: Offshore business development strategy, New Zealand focus, US prioritization

column13: supporting and developing the growth of new and emerging sectors. Over recent years, ASX has focused on expanding the number of technology and healthcare companies listed on the exchange, including the launch of the S&P/ ASX All Technology Index, which has enhanced the profile and understanding of the technology sector in Australia
column20: Growth of new sectors, Technology and healthcare, S&P/ ASX All Technology Index

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: New markets will require new data. As part of the innovation strategy, we aim to support customer use cases with other data services to solve business problems in areas such as the carbon market, ESG and digital assets. We will collaborate with our customers on innovation initiatives that add value as technology and business models evolve.
column20: Innovation strategy, Collaboration with customers, Technology evolution

column13: ASX has supported TCFD since 2019 and recommends issuers use the TCFD framework to disclose climate-related risks and opportunities. It is the third year ASX has reported on its approach to climate change, adopting the TCFD recommendations and guidance.
column20: TCFD framework adoption, Climate-related risks, Climate change approach

column13: The 2023 TCFD report updates progress against the scenario analysis captured in 2021. These scenarios assessed ASX's inherent climate risks and opportunities that may arise under 1.5C and 4C scenarios over the two-time horizons of 2030 and 2050.
column20: TCFD scenario analysis, Climate risks assessment, Climate opportunities evaluation

column6: Defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans
column7: ASX's remuneration framework focuses Executive KMP on attaining long-term, sustainable performance. It is achieved by connecting our Executive KMP to the experience of shareholders through equity-based deferral of their STVR and the LTVR. The LTVR rewards the achievement of challenging performance hurdles based on the underlying EPS compound annual growth rate and ASX's relative TSR compared to other ASX 100 companies, excluding property trusts. Both performance measures are assessed over four years.

column8: Clearing House Electronic Subregister System (CHESS) platform replacement
column13: The ongoing project to replace the Clearing House Electronic Subregister System (CHESS) platform, which supports clearing and settlement in Australia's cash equity market, is in the solution design stage. ASX is continuing to work towards announcing the new solution design in the final quarter of the calendar year, subject to the formation of the industry Advisory Group, industry input and regulatory expectations.
column20: Replacement of CHESS platform, Clearing and settlement, Solution design

column6: Significant indirect economic impacts
column13: ASX is also under consideration by the Clean Energy Regulator to operate the Australian Carbon Exchange, which will allow the trading, clearing, and settlement of Australian Carbon Credit Units (ACCUs) to support businesses and governments in decarbonising.
column20: Australian Carbon Exchange operation, Carbon trading, Decarbonizing support

column8: Mandatory online training on the policies
column13: Training:ÃÂ All ASX employees must complete mandatory online policy training annually. This includes an assessment to ensure an understanding of the content and intention of these policies. ASX supports the annual renewal of employees' professional memberships and qualifications
column20: Mandatory policy training, Annual assessment, Policy understanding

column13: The consequence management framework outlines the consequences for breaches of behavioural expectations. ASX's Conduct Review Group monitors and investigates instances where employee behaviour is not consistent with these expectations to ensure that consequences are consistently applied, fair and appropriate
column20: Consequence management framework, Behavioral breaches, Conduct Review Group

column7: Under the Code of Conduct, you have a responsibility to help detect, prevent and report instances of bribery and corruption as well as any other suspicious activity or wrongdoing in connection with ASX's business. ASX is committed to ensuring you have a safe, reliable, confidential way of reporting suspicious activity. You are encouraged to raise concerns about any issue or suspicion of malpractice with your manager as soon as possible. If you are unsure whether a particular act constitutes bribery or corruption or have any other queries or concerns, these should be raised with your manager and/or Enterprise Compliance.\t

Approach to tax
column13: ASX publishes a Tax Transparency Report each year as a signatory to the voluntary Tax Transparency Code issued by the Australian Government Board of Taxation. ASX takes a low-risk approach to managing its tax position, which includes not entering into transactions or structures with the primary objective of reducing tax liabilities. ASX is proud to be an Australian company and of the economic contribution made through the yearly tax.
column20: Tax Transparency Report, Voluntary Tax Transparency Code, Low-risk tax management

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column13: As a large organisation, ASX is included in the Australian Tax Office's (ATO) top 1,000 Justified Trust Program, designed to build and maintain community confidence that taxpayers are paying the right amount of tax and are identifying and addressing tax risks. ASX obtained high assurance in the ATO's Streamline Assurance Review (income tax only) and Combined Assurance Review (income tax and GST) review.
column20: Inclusion in ATO's Justified Trust Program, Taxpayer confidence, Tax risk management

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
column7: ASX continues to look for opportunities to support the decarbonisation of the Australian economy. Our electricity futures products are essential tools supporting investment in decarbonisation, and we continue developing our carbon futures products.

column6: Country-by-country reporting
column7: In FY23, ASX's effective tax rate for the Group was 29.0%, and we paid a total tax contribution of $287.8 million.

column13: Delivered a feasibility site assessment identifying a viable opportunity to install 80kW of rooftop photovoltaic at the Australian Liquidity Centre (ALC), potentially saving 3,000 MWh or $500,000 over the system's lifetime.

column13: Targeting Net Zero Scope 1 and Scope 2 emissions in FY25. ASX will meet this target by decarbonising our operations by purchasing 100% renewable electricity and eliminating unavoidable residual emissions with high-quality Australian Carbon Credit Units (ACCUs).
column20: Net Zero emissions target, Decarbonization strategy, Renewable electricity

column6: Reduction of energy consumption
column13: ASX implemented new energy-saving projects, including a wide range of measures from improved heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) systems to lighting upgrades. These energy-saving projects will save an estimated $30,000 (cost efficiencies) and 141.3 MW/year (consumption efficiencies).
column20: Energy-saving projects, HVAC systems, Lighting upgrades
